transportAdvice: Bangkok has an extensive elevated rail network and underground metro that connects major tourist areas, shopping districts, and transit hubs, making it practical for getting around without a car. Metered taxis and motorcycle taxis are widely available, though walking long distances is generally uncomfortable due to heat, humidity, and uneven footpaths.

weather.description: Cool and dry by Bangkok standards, with pleasant evenings and minimal rain — one of the best months to visit.
Warm and mostly sunny with low rainfall, making it an excellent time for sightseeing.
Temperatures begin to climb noticeably and it remains dry, though midday heat can be intense.
One of the hottest months of the year with increasing humidity and the occasional heavy shower.
The wet season begins in earnest with frequent afternoon thunderstorms and high humidity throughout the day.
Regular heavy rain and overcast skies are typical, though showers are often short-lived and intense.
Wet season continues with consistent rainfall and high humidity; indoor attractions are a good option.
One of the wettest months, with frequent downpours and a risk of localized flooding in low-lying areas.
Peak of the rainy season with heavy and prolonged rainfall; flooding can occasionally disrupt travel.
Rain begins to ease toward the end of the month but remains frequent, with humidity still elevated.
The wet season winds down and conditions become more comfortable, with cooler evenings returning.
Dry, relatively cool, and pleasant — a popular month to visit with comfortable daytime temperatures.
